snippet: The state and the federal government have wagered $1.9 billion on a project intended to improve the health of low-income people and lower the rate of spending growth.
abstract: Oregon and federal government, under agreement signed by Obama administration in 2012, have wagered $1.9 billion that grass-roots leadership holds key to fixing health care in America; through hyper-local focus on Medicaid, state hopes to show both improved health outcomes for low-income populations and lower rate of spending growth than rest of nation.
lead_paragraph: The state and the federal government have wagered $1.9 billion on a project intended to improve the health of low-income people and lower the rate of spending growth.

headline.main: Experiment in Oregon Gives Medicaid Very Local Roots
headline.print_headline: $1.9 Billion Oregon Experiment Gives Federal Medicaid Program Local Roots
